function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is an online Samsung store offering various products like Galaxy smartphones. It includes product listings, a cart feature, and a cart overlay for viewing added products.","new_testing_goal":"Add a new product to the cart and view the cart overlay again.","explanation":"1. Click on the 'add to cart' button of a product that has not been added before.\n2. Open the cart overlay to view the newly added product.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"5:rr:"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.

Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

Open the cart overlay to view the newly added product.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r0:-galaxy"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.
Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Clear the cart and ensure the total is updated correctly. Then, proceed to checkout by clicking the 'Checkout' button..

Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Add a product to the cart and view the cart overlay.": 1, "Add a product to the cart and view the cart overlay again.": 3, "Add a new product to the cart and view the cart overlay again.": 4, "Clear the cart and ensure the total is updated correctly. Then, proceed to checkout by clicking the 'Checkout' button.": 1}.

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.

Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: 5:rr:, 6:rr:, 7:rr:, 8:rr:, 9:rr:, 10:rr:, 11:rr:, 12:rr:, :r0:-home, :r0:-galaxy, :r0:-s10, :r0:-m_series, :r0:-a_series, :r1:, :r2:. You cannot use the "click" action with the element id ":r7:" because it is not applicable.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with
